triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The primary machine learning technique used to train the humanoid robot agent to play soccer.

triples.name: Humanoid robot
triples.relevance: The physical system the paper trains using low-cost miniature humanoid robots.

triples.name: Association football
triples.relevance: Soccer as the competitive task domain that the robot agent learns to play in a one-versus-one setting.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The foundational machine learning paradigm that deep RL builds upon for training the robot through interactions with its environment.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: The technique enabling zero-shot sim-to-real transfer from simulation training to actual robot deployment.

triples.name: Robot control
triples.relevance: High-frequency control mechanisms essential for synthesizing the robot's sophisticated movement skills.

triples.name: Bipedalism
triples.relevance: The bipedal walking locomotion form that the humanoid robot must master for movement skills like walking and turning.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Deep learning architecture underlying the deep RL agent for processing observations and generating control actions.

triples.name: Robot locomotion
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel approach to learning sophisticated robot locomotion and movement skills through deep reinforcement learning for bipedal humanoid robots.
